New Records: Shadab Khan scored 52 off 22 balls and took 2 wickets, while Iftikhar Ahmed contributed 51 off 35 balls; Pakistan scored 185 in 20 overs after opting to bat; South Africa were set a revised target of 142 after rain but fell short; Shadab Khan and Shaheen Afridi were the key bowlers
Key Match Events: The match was rain-curtailed, leading to a revised target; Shadab Khan's quickfire 52 and Iftikhar Ahmed's crucial 51 stabilized Pakistan's innings; South Africa struggled to chase down the target despite efforts from Tristan Stubbs and Heinrich Klaasen
Pre-Game Insights: Pakistan won the toss and opted to bat; key players like Shadab Khan and Iftikhar Ahmed were crucial in turning the game around after an early wicket; the match was significant for Pakistan's qualification hopes
Post-Match Reflections: The win kept Pakistan's qualification hopes alive; Pakistan moved to third place in Group 2 with 4 points; South Africa continued to stay second behind India with 5 points
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was part of the Super 12 stage; Pakistan's victory was crucial as it was the last day of the group stage; the absence of David Miller due to injury impacted South Africa's performance
Others: The match saw a mix of high-pressure moments, outstanding performances, and weather-related interruptions
